intro: Bilacunaria boissieri, commonly known as the Boissier's bilacunaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
